title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (09), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Nepal lifts ban on social media apps after deadly protests
byline: Nepal’s government has lifted a ban on about two dozen social media platforms after the curb ignited youth-led demonstrations across the country on Monday that saw more than a dozen protesters killed in the capital Kathmandu.

title: Over 1,800 killed in road accidents this year
byline: A total of 1,870 individuals have lost their lives in 1,757 fatal road accidents that occurred between January 1 and September 4 of this year, according to police.

title: Gaza aid flotilla, carrying Greta Thunberg, struck by drone off Tunisia coast
byline: The Global Sumud Flotilla, an aid ship to Gaza was struck by a drone on Tuesday off the coast of Tunisia.

title: Train services on Kelani Valley Line restricted to Kosgama
byline: Train services along the Kelani Valley Line have been restricted to the Kosgama Railway Station, the Railway Control Room said.

title: Sri Lanka needs thinkers who question, create, and innovate – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasized the importance of nurturing a new generation equipped with creativity, curiosity, and critical thinking, stressing that the Sri Lanka’s future depends on individuals who can question existing knowledge, think differently, and use innovation to address global challenges.

title: Thai court orders ex-PM Thaksin Shinawatra must serve one year in jail
byline: Thailand’s Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled billionaire Thaksin Shinawatra must serve one year in jail, in another major blow for a powerful family that has dominated politics for two decades.

title: UK deeply concerned by Sri Lanka’s continued use of PTA to ‘restrict fundamental freedoms’
byline: The United Kingdom (UK) has called for “tangible and sustained progress” on human rights and accountability in Sri Lanka while also emphasizing the importance of exhuming and investigating mass grave sites in accordance with international standards.

title: Former Minister Rajitha produced before court
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who was remanded in custody following his arrest, was produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court this morning (09).

title: Sri Lanka reaffirms commitment to achieving reconciliation at UN Human Rights Council
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has underlined the commitment and the political will of the new government for transformation in Sri Lanka and to create a new political culture to advance the rights and well-being of all citizens.

title: Speaker announces SC verdict on Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill
byline: The Speaker of Parliament (Dr.) Jagath Wickramaratne announced today (09) that the Supreme Court has determined that no provision of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill is inconsistent with any provisions of the Constitution of Sri Lanka.

title: Ten people killed, 61 hurt after train hits double-decker bus in Mexico
byline: Ten people were killed and at least 61 were injured in central Mexico when a freight train smashed into a double-decker passenger bus, which the train operator said had been attempting to pass in front of the moving train.

title: Colombo Magistrate’s Court concludes corruption case against Keheliya and family
byline: As the Bribery Commission has filed a case against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and his family members before the Colombo High Court on charges under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanka S. Bodaragama today... MOREE..

title: Cabinet approval to present 2026 Appropriation Bill to Parliament
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the submission of the Appropriation Bill for the 2026 financial tear to the Parliament.

title: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne granted bail
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court this morning (09).

title: Sri Lanka secures USD 100 million funding from World Bank to enhance rural economy
byline: More than 380,000 people across Sri Lanka are set to benefit from a new US$100 million partnership between the Government of Sri Lanka and the World Bank Group aimed at strengthening rural livelihoods, creating jobs, and building climate resilience in the agri-food sector.

title: Second reading debate on Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill tomorrow
byline: The Communications Department of the Sri Lanka Parliament announced that the Parliamentary Affairs Committee has decided to hold the debate on the Second Reading of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill tomorrow (September 10).

title: Sri Lanka records USD 5.11B remittances in first 8 months of 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that a total of 212,302 Sri Lankan workers have left for overseas employment during the eight-month period from January to August 2025.

title: Sampath Manamperi an ex-cop and suspect in Raviraj murder – Cabinet Spokesman
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa reveals that Sampath Manamperi, who is accused of concealing two container loads of raw materials allegedly used to manufacture the drug ‘Ice’ and belonging to underworld figure ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, has been identified as a former police intelligence officer.

title: Nepal Parliament breached, building set on fire by Gen Z protesters
byline: Minutes before Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned from his office, Gen Z protesters broke into Parliament and set fire to one of the buildings on the premises.

title: Sectoral Oversight Committee on Justice approves Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Governance, Justice, and Civil Protection has approved the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill.

title: No reports of injuries to Sri Lankans due to violent protests in Nepal: MFA
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated that so far there have been no reports of any Sri Lankans being injured owing to on-going protests in Nepal.

title: Shooting incident reported in Ambalangoda
byline: Two individuals on a motorcycle have reportedly opened fire at several persons travelling in a three-wheeler on Heenatiya Road in Ambalangoda.

title: France’s Macron seeks new prime minister after government’s collapse
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron is seeking his fifth prime minister in less than two years after opposition parties united to kick out centre-right Prime Minister Francois Bayrou over his unpopular plans for budget tightening.

title: Police warn public on fire hazards of ‘sky lanterns’
byline: Sri Lanka Police have cautioned the general public regarding the serious risks associated with the indiscriminate use of sky lanterns during festive seasons and special celebrations across the island.

title: Nepal PM resigns after deadly protests triggered by social media ban
byline: Nepal’s prime minister KP Sharma Oli has resigned after violent anti-corruption protests.

title: Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport closed until further notice
byline: Tribhuvan International Airport (TIA) has been fully closed following escalating demonstrations across the Kathmandu Valley.

title: Several blasts heard in Qatar’s Doha, Israeli media says Hamas leadership targeted
byline: Israeli army radio said Israel tried to attack Hamas officials in Qatar on Tuesday.

title: Foreign Ministry issues advisory for Sri Lankans in Nepal
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises Sri Lankans in Nepal to take precautions and remain indoors to protect themselves from possible attacks amidst the ongoing violent protests in the country.

title: Sweden launches AI music licence to protect songwriters
byline: Sweden’s music rights organisation has introduced a licence that allows artificial intelligence companies to legally use copyrighted songs for training their models, while ensuring that songwriters and composers are paid.

title: Kamal Haasan confirms reunion with Rajinikanth after 46 years
byline: A casting coup is in the making as Tamil superstars Kamal Haasan, 70, and Rajinikanth, 74, are all set to reunite on the big screen 46 years after their last film together, IV Sasi’s 1979 fantasy film Allauddinum Albhutha Vilakkum, which was based on Aladdin’s story One Thousand and One Nights.

title: Nepal’s Supreme Court and ministers’ homes set on fire amidst public revolt
byline: Nepal’s Parliament building, Supreme Court, and residences of several senior leaders were set ablaze on Tuesday as anti-government protests spiralled out of control, minutes after Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned.

title: CP Radhakrishnan elected as India’s 15th Vice President
byline: BJP veteran and former Maharashtra governor CP Radhakrishnan was elected the Vice President of India on Tuesday, defeating Opposition INDIA bloc nominee Justice (retd) B. Sudershan Reddy in a largely one-sided contest.

title: Resolution on agreement between Sri Lanka and UAE passed in Parliament
byline: The resolution on the agreement between Sri Lanka and the United Arab Emirates has been passed in Parliament today (09) with a majority of 163 votes.

title: Electricity tariffs to increase by 6.8%?
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board has proposed a 6.8% increase in electricity tariffs for the final quarter of 2025, according to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka.

title: Nepal Army to take charge of security following violent protests
byline: The Nepal Army on Tuesday said that it will take charge of security operations from 10 pm, hours after Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned following 27 hours of violent protests in Kathmandu and other parts of the country.
